Aarakocra.description: Bird-like humanoids with the ability to fly.

AirGenasi.description: Genasi infused with the power of air.

BeasthideShifter.description: Shifters with enhanced toughness when shifting.

Changeling.description: Shapeshifters with the ability to alter their appearance at will.

Dragonborn.description: Dragonborn look very much like dragons standing erect in humanoid form, though they lack wings or a tail.

traits.draconicAncestry: Choose one type of dragon as your ancestor. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type
traits.breathWeapon: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy
traits.damageResistance: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry

Dwarf.description: Bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners, and workers of stone and metal.

traits.dwarvenResilience: Advantage on saving throws against poison, and resistance against poison damage
traits.dwarvenCombatTraining: Proficiency with battleaxe, handaxe, light hammer, and warhammer
traits.toolProficiency: Proficiency with one set of artisan's tools of your choice
traits.stonecunning: Add double proficiency bonus to Intelligence (History) checks related to the origin of stonework

EarthGenasi.description: Genasi infused with the power of earth.

Elf.description: Elves are a magical people of otherworldly grace, living in the world but not entirely part of it.

traits.feyAncestry: Advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep
traits.trance: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply for 4 hours a day

Fairy.description: Magical, diminutive creatures with the ability to fly.

FireGenasi.description: Genasi infused with the power of fire.

Gnome.description: A gnome's energy and enthusiasm for living shines through every inch of his or her tiny body.

traits.gnomeCunning: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic

Goliath.description: Large, athletic humanoids with a penchant for competition and survival.

Half-Elf.description: Half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents.

abilityScoreIncrease.other: Increase two other ability scores of your choice by 1

traits.feyAncestry: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep
traits.skillVersatility: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice
languages: One extra language of your choice

Half-Orc.description: Half-orcs' grayish pigmentation, sloping foreheads, jutting jaws, prominent teeth, and towering builds make their orcish heritage plain for all to see.

traits.menacing: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill
traits.relentlessEndurance: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest
traits.savageAttacks: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit

Halfling.description: The diminutive halflings survive in a world full of larger creatures by avoiding notice or, barring that, avoiding offense.

traits.lucky: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die
traits.brave: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened
traits.halflingNimbleness: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours

Hobgoblin.description: Disciplined and militaristic goblinoids with a strong sense of duty.

Human.description: Humans are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Whatever drives them, humans are the innovators, the achievers, and the pioneers of the worlds.

languages: One extra language of your choice

Kalashtar.description: Humans bound with quori spirits, possessing psychic abilities.

Kenku.description: Avian humanoids with a talent for mimicry but cursed to be flightless.

LongtoothShifter.description: Shifters with enhanced biting capabilities when shifting.

Owlin.description: Owl-like humanoids with natural flying abilities.

PallidElf.description: Subterranean elves with enhanced perception and stealth abilities.

SeaElf.description: Aquatic elves adapted to life beneath the waves.

Shifter.description: Descendants of humans and lycanthropes with the ability to partially shift form.

SwiftstrideShifter.description: Shifters with enhanced speed and agility when shifting.

Tabaxi.description: Feline humanoids with natural agility and curiosity.

Tiefling.description: To be greeted with stares and whispers, to suffer violence and insult on the street, to see mistrust and fear in every eye: this is the lot of the tiefling.

traits.hellishResistance: You have resistance to fire damage
traits.infernalLegacy: You know the thaumaturgy cantrip. Once you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hellish rebuke spell once per day as a 2nd-level spell. Once you reach 5th level, you can also cast the darkness spell once per day. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells

Triton.description: Amphibious humanoids from the depths of the sea.

Warforged.description: Constructed beings created for war, blending living and mechanical parts.

WaterGenasi.description: Genasi infused with the power of water.

YuanTiPureblood.description: Snake-like humanoids with innate magical abilities.
